metadata.ttm:title: Cooperative Purchasing
metadata.ttm:desc: The Cooperative Purchasing Modification enables Contractors to opt into the Cooperative Purchasing Program, in which local and tribal governments can acquire services through a specific set of GSA Schedule Contracts.

div.p: GSA is the government's savings agency, but this
is not limited to only federal agencies.
The Cooperative Purchasing Program allows state,
local, and tribal governments to enjoy the
benefits of pre-vetted vendors on information
technology and law enforcement products and
services offered through Schedule 70 and Schedule
Eligible entities may purchase from these
pre-vetted vendors at any time, for any reason,
using any funds available.
Items under the Cooperative Purchasing
program will stand out to these state, local, and
tribal entities on GSA Advantage by being marked
with a special icon.
The Cooperative Purchasing modification allows you to
enter or withdraw selected SINs from this program.
Select the desired SIN from the dropdown menu
then click "Update SIN Details."
The SIN details will show you whether the chosen SIN
is currently enrolled in the Cooperative Purchasing
program.
Choose whether you wish to be enrolled in the program
and click "Update this SIN."
If you would like to make changes to your
Cooperative Purchasing enrollment or if you have
made an error and wish to delete the change in scope
you may do so with the "Edit" and "Delete" links.
When you are finished click "Save and Continue."
